Detailed Description

API of the library to talk to the "AberBox".

The box controls relays used to switch on and off devices, has access to an inclinometer and (will) control a stabilised pan and tilt platform (including compensation of its drift).

Author:
Dave Price <dap@aber.ac.uk>

Function Documentation

int box_connect ( char *  hostname,
int  portnumber 
)

Establish connection to the control box.

This must be done before anything else.

Parameters:
[in]hostnameName of the computer in the box (can be an IP address).
[in]portnumberNumber of the port the box is listening to.
Returns:
0 in case of failure, 1 otherwise.
void box_shutdown ( )

Shut down the control box.

This also disconnects from the box.

void getInclinometer ( float *  retVal)

Get the attitude of the inclinometer plugged into the box.

Parameters:
[out]retValAn array of two floats (must be allocated elsewhere): the first element is the side-to-side value, the second element is the fore-aft value.
int getRelayN ( int  relay)

Get the state of a given relay.

Parameters:
[in]relayThe relay number (starting from 0).
Returns:
The state of the relay, 1 for on, 0 for off.
int getRelays ( )

Get the state of all the relays.

Returns:
The state of all the relays. The format of the returned value is one bit per relay, 1 meaning on and 0 meaning off. The least significant bit corresponds to relay 0, up to 32 relays.
int resetRelayN ( int  relay)

Set a given relay to the off state.

Parameters:
[in]relayThe relay number (starting from 0).
Returns:
0 in case of failure, 1 otherwise.
void setPanTilt ( float  pan,
float  tilt,
float *  retVal 
)

Set the pan and tilt values of the PT unit controlled by the box.

This is not yet implemented.

Parameters:
[in]panThe pan between 0 and 360, with 0 looking backwards over the left of the rover.
[in]tiltThe tilt between 0 and 180, with 0 looking down.
[out]retValAn array of two floats (must be allocated elsewhere): the first element is the pan value, the second element is the tilt value.
int setRelayN ( int  relay)

Set a given relay to the on state.

Parameters:
[in]relayThe relay number (starting from 0).
Returns:
0 in case of failure, 1 otherwise.
int setRelays ( int  value)

Set all the relays of the box.

Parameters:
[in]valueThe format of the parameter is one bit per relay, 1 meaning on and 0 meaning off. The least significant bit corresponds to relay 0, up to 32 relays.
Returns:
0 in case of failure, 1 otherwise.
